event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Platform administrator should investigate the cause of the over-temperature condition. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: Dangerous over-temperature condition detected by an exhaust temperature sensor or CPU temperature sensor.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
Dangerous over-temperature condition detected by an exhaust temperature sensor or CPU temperature sensor.


   SPARC Enterprise M3000/4000/M5000 platforms:

      Platform is powered down.

   
   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platform:

      Platform is powered down.


   SPARC Enterprise M9000 platforms:

      Depending upon which temperature sensors detected the dangerous over-temperature condition,
      either the entire platform is powered down or the domains affected by the dangerous
      over-temperature condition are powered down.



The recommended service action for this event is outlined in the steps below.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:39:17 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 4fd92bb6-1914-4eff-87de-d733e4f29c89
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8006-4C for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8006-4C, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:39:17 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 4fd92bb6-1914-4eff-87de-d733e4f29c89
   DESC: Dangerous over-temperature condition detected by an exhaust temperature sensor or CPU
   temperature sensor.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8006-4C for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Nothing is deconfigured. Either the platform will be powered down or specific domains will
   be powered down. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: Either the platform will be powered down or specific domains will be powered down.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Platform administrator should investigate the cause of the over-temperature condition.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 4fd92bb6-1914-4eff-87de-d733e4f29c89

   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 20 21:39:17.3943 4fd92bb6-1914-4eff-87de-d733e4f29c89 SCF-8006-4C
     100%  fault.chassis.env.temp.over-fail

           Problem in: hc:///chassis=0
              Affects: -
                  FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                       server-id=san-ff2-21-0/component=CHASSIS



Step 3. Platform administrator should investigate the cause of the over-temperature condition.
        
           If unable to identify the cause of the over-temperature condition,
             then contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Either the platform will be powered down or specific domains will be powered down. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Nothing is deconfigured. Either the platform will be powered down or specific domains will be powered down. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Dangerous over-temperature condition detected on platform.
